Instruction: Cut fish fillets into bite-sized pieces.
Open coconut milk and reserve 1/4 cup for later.
Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Saut√© onion, garlic, and ginger until softened.
Add curry powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder to the skillet. Stir-fry for 30 seconds, or until fragrant.
Pour in the remaining coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add fish fillets to the curry and cook until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Stir in the reserved 1/4 cup of coconut milk.
Garnish with cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice.
Serve with rice or naan bread.
